intro: Anthemis tricolor var. artemisioides, commonly known as the three-color everlasting or artemisioid false chamomile, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring gray-green, hairy leaves and yellow-orange flower heads. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in rocky or dry habitats. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional medicine.
